title: Using Webber
text: package utility belt working Western blot images R. ’s primarily focused making annotation easier.
code: library(webber) library(magick) #> Linking to ImageMagick 6.9.11.60 #> Enabled features: fontconfig, freetype, fftw, heic, lcms, pango, webp, x11 #> Disabled features: cairo, ghostscript, raw, rsvg #> Using 2 threads library(tibble)

title: Using Webber
text: need introduce webber can easily pull files Sharepoint. Fortunately, ’s rather simple: just run wb_setup(). ’ll tell paste lines .Rprofile (handily open ), ’ll need add folder name (just lastname-firstname). restart R, ready go (provided ’ve introduced Sharepoint)

title: Using Webber
text: time don’t really know exact path file ’m looking . webber makes easy wb_list: Notice didn’t specify name - ’s introduction earlier. wanted root around someone else’s folder, : want drill deeper folder, can :
code: wb_list("/") |> head() #>                                                                   name    size #> 1                                Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-04 4480648 #> 2                        Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-20_bupa-dr 2018128 #> 3                        Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-20_erda-tc 1492864 #> 4                        Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-20_pemi-tc  746432 #> 5                  Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-28_rt112-igfr-kd 1064087 #> 6 Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-05-11_uc14-nt-835_nt-irf1si_wo-w-dox 4424925 #>   isdir                                 id #> 1  TRUE 013PDU6SSJG5PQELW2JZB22SXQOVX5UNEQ #> 2  TRUE 013PDU6SWOQEF2EVTREZCKCPYEMYQAS2BY #> 3  TRUE 013PDU6SQZBJKUT7YZHBGZHXKHALNKEPYU #> 4  TRUE 013PDU6SSHCQEVJEMGJRGIPXSQV7UNJBEX #> 5  TRUE 013PDU6SXTXPJ3Y5NEWJH3CTHSNYXQ6YMN #> 6  TRUE 013PDU6SWZLCYWV3XAZJF2YVX2LTAQL2IW wb_list("/", user = "arbuiso-alyssa") #>                                                         name     size isdir #> 1 Raw Data/licor/arbuiso-alyssa/2023-02-14_rt112-100nm-cm272 41214201  TRUE #>                                   id #> 1 013PDU6SU3ESBH6BUQTBAKQ7JFLBKJ3V6R wb_list("/2022-04-20_bupa-dr") #>                                                                name    size #> 1            Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-20_bupa-dr/pakt.tif  996356 #> 2 Raw Data/licor/aragaki-kai/2022-04-20_bupa-dr/pakt-s473-actin.tif 1021772 #>   isdir                                 id #> 1 FALSE 013PDU6SQNCRN5B6WB2ZBJJNIQGWNMRGBW #> 2 FALSE 013PDU6SWOT55JIX5VCBGLU2ZW5OYDGUHC

title: Using Webber
text: ’ve found file folder interest, download wb_get. ’m going download single file, can whole folders:
code: file <- wb_get(   path = "2022-04-20_bupa-dr/pakt-s473-actin.tif",   dest = tempfile(),   overwrite = TRUE )

title: Using Webber
text: file hand, can now edit . , call upon delightful magick R package, uses imagemagick hood.  first part - hardest part - cropping size. imagemagick (henceforth magick) specifies TOP LEFT corner (0, 0). :  get upper left hand portion. wanted offset area (still want 100x300, say, want closer bottom) can specify offset:  want closer middle:  make sure crop right portion? Unfortunately don’t perfect answer . can trial error, can bring photo editor measure dimensions coordinates crop . things reproducibility.  Now just happens dose response backward - higher concentrations left, lower right. prefer way.  Great - ’re ready annotate!
code: image <- image_read(file) image image_crop(image, "100x300") |>   plot() image_crop(image, "100x300+0+100") |>   plot() image_crop(image, "100x300+100+0") |>   plot() cropped <- image_crop(image, "370x100+90+200") plot(cropped) flopped <- image_flop(cropped) plot(flopped)

title: Using Webber
text: Now, back webber. annotate blot lanes webber, need construct tibble one row per lane, one column per line annotation. supply tibble wb_annot_lanes:
code: # Why a tibble and not a regular data.frame? # tibbles preserve spaces in their column names, which makes them display nicer. annot <-    tibble(     "Cell line" = "UC6",     "Buparlisib (nM)" = c("DMSO", "1", "10", "100", "1000", "10000")   ) annot #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   `Cell line` `Buparlisib (nM)` #>   <chr>       <chr>             #> 1 UC6         DMSO              #> 2 UC6         1                 #> 3 UC6         10                #> 4 UC6         100               #> 5 UC6         1000              #> 6 UC6         10000 wb <- wb_annot_lanes(flopped, annot, n_lanes = 6, text_size = 4) plot(wb)

title: Wrangle and Annotate Blots Semi-Automatically
text: NOTE: PACKAGE PERSONAL USE WON’T WORK UNLESS MODIFY , WELCOME ! ’S FOSS BABY! Webber assistant help manage edit blots metadata. providing suite tools help edit download data, well enforcing documentation format makes automated annotation (querying) easy.

what: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
text: Downloads Western blot image returns path. already exists specified location, downloading occur unless overwrite = TRUE. return local path file.

title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
code: wb_get(   path,   dest,   overwrite = FALSE,   user = Sys.getenv("WEBBER_USR"),   wb_path = Sys.getenv("WEBBER_WBPATH"),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
text: path Character. path image/directory, sans wb_path. dest Character. path save image/directory. extension, assumed mean folder, folder already exists. overwrite Logical. files overwritten already exist? user Character. Whose folder file pulled . wb_path Character. Path top level directory contains western blots. quiet Logical. function message upon finding existing files?

title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
text: Character. local path file directory.

title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
text: thin wrapper around bladdr::get_gbci_file, hard-coded paths - quality--life function.

title: Download a Western blot by path — wb_get
code: if (FALSE) { wb_get(   "2022-06-22/h3.tif",   tempdir(),   user = "aragaki-kai",   wb_path = "Raw Data/licor" ) }

title: List files in a directory — wb_list
text: path Character. path image, sans wb_path recursive Logical. folders folders recursively indexed ? user Whose folder file pulled ? wb_path Character. Path top level directory contains western blots.

text: data.frame path item SharePoint

code: if (FALSE) { wb_list(   "2022-02-04_mcconkey_fgfr3",   recursive = TRUE,   user = "aragaki-kai",   wb_path = "Raw Data/ChemiDoc" ) wb_list(   "2022-02-04_mcconkey_fgfr3",   recursive = FALSE,   user = "aragaki-kai",   wb_path = "Raw Data/ChemiDoc" ) }

title: Upload a Western Blot — wb_put
text: thin wrapper around upload_file function Microsoft365R, just defaults safeguards tailored uploading Western Blots. theoretically upload anything way. overwrite without prompting.

title: Upload a Western Blot — wb_put
code: wb_put(   path,   dest_path,   wb_edit_path = Sys.getenv("WEBBER_WBEDITPATH"),   user = Sys.getenv("WEBBER_USR"),   drive = NULL )

title: Upload a Western Blot — wb_put
text: path Character. Path local file. dest_path Character. Path upload file. See details. wb_edit_path Character. Path Western blot edits kept. user Character. User directory name. drive optional ms_drive object. none supplied, make one automatically.

title: Upload a Western Blot — wb_put
text: Character. Path file Sharepoint.

title: Upload a Western Blot — wb_put
text: uploaded file location produced via fs::path(wb_edit_path, user, dest_path)
